intro: Paraboea punggulensis, commonly known as the Punggul paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Indonesia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
